settings.title: About Cearvol
settings.content:
Our group has been deeply rooted in the acoustics industry for nearly twenty years. We’ve focused on headphones as our core product, constantly pushing innovation in both technology and design to deliver listening experiences that are high-performing and stylish.

Over the years, we’ve also served as an ODM partner for leading global audio brands, including JBL, Sennheiser, Beyerdynamic, Soundcore, and OPPO. These collaborations have strengthened our expertise in acoustic engineering and cemented our reputation for strict quality standards.

As the company grew, we realized that the power of sound technology goes far beyond entertainment—it can truly transform lives.

settings.title: From Sound to Hearing Care
settings.content:
This inspired us to naturally embark on our second growth curve: hearing aids. Unlike the traditional, medicalized image, we aim to leverage the acoustic expertise and design aesthetics we have built in headphones to redefine what hearing aids can be.

Our products are designed to be lightweight, elegant, reliable, and affordable—bringing hearing solutions within reach for more people.

With our technical capabilities and manufacturing excellence, we are now also a trusted partner for brands within the ecosystem of the global top five hearing aid groups, continuing to refine our craft under world-class standards.

At EUHA 2025, we unveiled our new brand message, “Stylish Hearing, Vibrant Living.” The showcase featured Cearvol’s latest innovations—from open-ear hearing aids to an early preview of our 2026 expansion into hearing glasses, signaling our next step toward integrating fashion, comfort, and acoustic technology. Our presence captured strong attention across the industry and media, further establishing Cearvol as a forward-looking force in the global hearing-health landscape.

At CES 2025, Cearvol made its global debut with a full-year product and concept lineup, showcasing our vision of AI-driven hearing equality. Our new ear-clip, semi-open hearing aid prototype drew strong interest from visitors and media, highlighting a fresh, stylish direction for future hearing solutions.
